caption: It is a very beautiful church with young, friendly, and really dedicated priests. The poor are fed here every day, and there is a lot of youth and life here. A great place for people seeking God, friendship and meaning of life

A quaint church in the marais area. Nice gothic architecture and some nice art pieces inside as well. There was about to be a mass when we entered, but the attendance and tourist numbers inside was not high. A great quick stop along your exploration path.

Whenever I go to a new town, city or area, I always go to a church. Whether you're religious or not, it's always nice to go to a place of worship to take a break from the hustle and bustle of life, to take stock of life and be still. The architecture in Saint Merry Church is magnificent, they don't build structures like this anymore so it's always nice to show respect to the past.

We were super happy to have had the chance to visit and attend the mass here. It’s a beautiful church. And the priest and parishioners were equally nice.  There is a mass scheduled at 630pm Saturdays.

A church for parishioners and serious religious students. Its beauty shines in the quiet light of introspection. Few tourists stray far enough from the Seine to find it. A rare example of building caught between the move from Roman architecture to early Gothic. Worthy of long slow study.

A hidden gem with friendly staff and nice concert at Sunday afternoon. Though my experience here was not that good, as a middle-aged blonde tourist acted as a "religion police" by rudely accusing others of taking photos even though they didn't raise telephone at all. It's apparently not somewhere to show off  your ignorance and prejudice, Karen.
A beautiful church with lovely stained glass windows. It was very quiet when I went and no other people were inside. This church is beautiful.

Saint-Merri (Eglise Saint Merri) is a 16th-century church, Flamboyant Gothic in architectural style along Rue de la Verrerie just a couple blocks south of Centre Pompidou in the Right Bank.  The exterior of the church is nice to view if you are a fan of Gothic architecture. The interior features an expectedly narrow and very  attractive nave with high vaulted ceiling. The main altarpiece - a sculpture of Christ being crucified is impressive, as are the stained-glass windows and18th-century carved pulpit. The aisle and side chapels provide more religious items and wall frescos to view within the church.  Interestingly, the church was hosting a contemporary art exhibition of sorts when we visited in December, showcasing some intriguing works of art that were at times as interesting to view as the interior of the church.  We enjoyed our brief visit to the Church of Saint-Merri and would gladly revisit while sightseeing around Le Marias in the future.
Magnificent church in its total disarray. Remarkable works of art inside.

Old neighborhood, active Catholic Church located just a few blocks from the Pompidou Center art gallery.  Not as well decorated as some Paris churches, but impressive, nonetheless.  Easy wheelchair access through the right hand door of the front entrance on Rue Saint-Martin.

We visited the Saint-Merri Church. It is  right next to the Pompidou Center in Paris downtown. This place is beautiful, well-maintained, and very charming. A must-visit location. Top quality of experience for us
Absolutely magnificent. Mind blowingly beautiful and well maintained church 500+ years old.
Absolutely beautiful; a great place to visit and attend Mass.
I was drawn to it because of its architecture. It looks awesome inside and out.
Nice gothic church with free Sunday concerts. A must in Paris. Arrive early as seats are scarce and doors close at the exact hour.

About 2 years ago some friends and I met some locals who took us to a music festival/Keith Haring art exhibit here. Super chill vibes with people lounging on carpets and swaying to the music. They also finished it off with an awesome performance on the Organ. it was one of the greatest things I have ever experienced and DEFINITELY a night I will never forget. They attached photos are just a little glimpse of the cool light effects they had as well!
Beautiful inside. Painted walls and ambiance leaves room for the Holy Spirit to shine
Beautiful Church.  Has been beautifully partially renovated when I visited.
Currently under restoration, still open to public. Some color stain glasses replace with plain ones. It's not as popular as other well-known churches.
I love this little Catholic Church.  It is a small community church, there for worship, not for tourist.
If you enjoy churches, be sure to pop inside. It’s very pretty and there’s some unusual art to enjoy.
One of rare church in Paris with Saint Eustache where you can hear contemporary shows and drink local beer inside.
I simply love all the old cathedrals in Paris. They are not only beautiful, but full of good energy. This cathedral is no different. Peaceful beautiful, and historic.
Pretty neat old church.  Not nearly as busy as the more well known churches, so it's a good place to take a look around.
Nice church, used not only for praying.

One of the most cordial and comforting worship/church experiences in my life. Many intense moments crammed into a Sunday morning. The highlight was standing in the Choir among the French parishioners who were singing the Celebration. The songs had the air of old camp sites and days gone by and cherished lifetime friendships. And enduring praise to God. And they actually invited me in, included me, let me sing with them (what little I could) nearly arm-in-arm. Blessings on them all.
A very beautiful, quiet church in Paris, not so well-known.
Beautiful church. Well keeped building.
Beautiful church, inside and outside. Free entrance
16 rosaries for peace
Such a peaceful place in the heart of the city
Very nice example of Gothic architecture but unfortunately the UNESCO should rescue it before it's too late
Nice place, it is free to enter and right near Centre Pompidou. Not anything particularly amazing about this Cathedral but worth stopping in quickly.
Great place for art purchase. And the prices are also descent
Really cool church. Recently went to a very cool art exhibition here. It really suits the feeling of this area of Paris.
Beautiful church, historic and traditional.  I went in a event with musicians. So great! Encharming!
Sunday afternoon free concerts at 1600.  Very good.
free
